citation.article-title: A new species of budding purple bacterium: Rhodopseudomonas julia sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Rhodopseudomonas julia sp. nov.
Rhodopseudomonas julia (ju.li.a. L. f. adj. julia - [discovered and described] in July)
Morphology and pigments.
The cells have the shape of straight or slightly curved rods. 1-1.5 x 2-5 μm in size.
Formation of rosettes is characteristic.
Propagation by budding; the bud is sessile.
Motile by means of polar flagella.
Gram-negative.
Photosynthetic membranes system: concentric lamellae.
The color of cell suspension is from pink to purple.
The absorption spectra of living cell suspensions show maxima at 380, 590, 803, and 850 nm (bacteriochlorophyll a) and at 490, 516, and 550 nm (carotenoids of the normal spirilloxanthin series).
Cultures.
Facultative photoorganoheterotrophs.
Can also crow chemoorganotrophically under microaerobic conditions and photolithoautotrophically.
OXidizing H2S or S0 to sulfate.
The intermediate product of H2S oxidation is elemental sulfur. which is deposited both outside and inside the cells.
Optimal growth conditions: pH 6.0-6.5, 25-35°C, light intensity more than 2000 x.
Ammonium salts and casamino acids, but not nitrate. are utilized as nitrogen sources; H2S, S0, cysteine. and glutathione. but not sulfate. serve as sulfur sources.
No vitamins are required.

Hydrogen donors and carbon sources: fatty acids to valerate, hydroxy acids of the tricarboxylic acid cycle, formate, pyruvate, aspartate, glycerol, glucose, gluconate, mannitl, sorbitol, fructose, yeast extract, casamino acids, Substrates not utilized: arginine, benzoate, glutamate, malonate, tartrate, citrate, alcohols.
Storage material - poly-α-hydroxybutyrate.
Catalase activity is present.
DNA-base ratio for type strain - 63.5 ± 1 mol %.
Habitat.
Slightly and moderately acid sulfide springs haVing a high content of elemental sulfur.
The type strain.
KR-11-67. is stored at the Hicroorganism Geochemical Activity Laboratory.
Institute of Microbiology.
USSR Academy of Sciences.
Moscow.
